Other common ingredients include beef broth, dark brown sugar, vinegar, and spices such as thyme, bay leaves, and cloves. Some variations may also include bacon or prunes. I'll definitely let you know how it turns out if I decide to cook it myself. Do you have any tips for making the perfect Flemish stew?

Sure, here are a few tips for making a delicious Flemish stew:

1. Use a good quality Belgian beer, preferably a dark beer, as it adds depth to the flavor of the stew.

2. Choose the right cut of beef - the best choice is a cut that contains marbled fat, such as chuck, flank or round.

3. Brown the meat well before adding it to the stew - this will add depth of flavor and help to create a rich, tasty sauce.

4. Cook the stew on low heat for at least 2 hours – this will help to tenderize the beef and allow the flavors to develop. 

5. Add the vinegar and sugar towards the end of the cooking time – this will help to balance the flavors of the stew.

6. Serve with crispy fries or mashed potatoes and a glass of Belgian beer for the perfect Flemish stew experience.

I hope these tips help you make a delicious Flemish stew. Enjoy!
